description.p: One of the most dangerous obsessions an artificer can pursue has always been mechanical flight. Many strive for this lofty goal, and all but the most dedicated, and often the most foolhardy, artificers fail in their pursuits. Experiments that end in disastrous explosions, catastrophic falls from the sky, and deadly malfunctions are not out of the norm for an Aeronaut perfecting their mechanical flying machine.
You constantly strive to achieve the lofty goal of every Aeronaut, the creation of an arcane flying machine.

When you adopt this specialization at 3rd level, you gain proficiency with woodcarver’s tools. If you are already proficient with woodcarver’s tools you instead gain proficiency with one type of artisan’s tools of your choice.

Upon reaching 3rd level, your experiments with flight have paid off. At the end of a long rest, as long as you have access to your woodcarver’s tools, you can construct a personal flying machine. You determine its appearance, and it can be used as a spellcasting focus for your artificer spells. You cannot operate your flying machine while wearing heavy armor or while you have a shield or heavy weapon equipped. You must use your woodcarver’s tools to maintain your flying machine as part of each long rest or it ceases to function.

As a bonus action on your turn, you can activate your flying machine to gain a temporary flying speed equal to your remaining movement speed. This flight lasts until the end of your current turn, at which point you fall to the ground unless you have a way to remain airborne. While using your flying speed, opportunity attacks against you have disadvantage.

sheet.description: At the end of a long rest, as long as you have access to your woodcarver’s tools, you can construct a personal flying machine. As a bonus action on your turn, you can activate your flying machine to gain a temporary flying speed of {{speed}} feet until the end of your current turn, at which point you fall to the ground unless you have a way to remain airborne. While using your flying speed, opportunity attacks against you have disadvantage.

At the end of a long rest, as long as you have access to your woodcarver’s tools, you can construct a personal flying machine. As a bonus action on your turn, you can activate your flying machine to gain a temporary flying speed of {{speed}} feet and can hover in place for up to 1 minute. While using your flying speed, opportunity attacks against you have disadvantage.

description.p: Your flying machine allows you to attack from unorthodox positions to inflict more damage. Starting at 5th level, when you are using your flying speed and are at least 5 feet off the ground, your attacks deal an additional 1d8 damage.
At 15th level this bonus damage increases to 2d8.

sheet.description: When you are using your flying speed and are at least 5 feet off the ground, your attacks deal an additional {{airborne-assault:damage}}d8 damage.

description.p: Beginning at 9th level, improvements to your flying machine have made it more reliable. When you activate your flying machine, you gain a flying speed equal to your movement speed and you can hover in place while midair. Your flying machine stays active in this way for one minute, unless you fall unconscious or deactivate it as a bonus action.
In addition, while you have your flying machine equipped, you gain a bonus to Dexterity ability checks and saving throws equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of 1)

sheet.description: While you have your flying machine equipped, you gain a +{{int-mod:min-one}} bonus to Dexterity ability checks and saving throws.

description.p: Upon reaching 15th level you have reached the peak of Aeronautical expertise. While your flying machine is equipped you have a permanent flying speed of 60 feet.

Additionally, if you are subjected to an effect that allows you to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage while your flying machine is equipped, you instead take no damage if you succeed on the saving throw, and only half damage if you fail.

sheet.description: While your flying machine is equipped you have a permanent flying speed of 60 feet. Additionally, if you are subjected to an effect that allows you to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage while your flying machine is equipped, you instead take no damage if you succeed on the saving throw, and only half damage if you fail.

description.p: For centuries chroniclers and librarians have sought the best way to store vast troves of information. While most were satisfied with scrolls, tomes, and books, the first archivists strove for something greater, storing libraries worth of information in one solitary object, and created the first artificial minds. As an archivist, you are on the cutting edge of arcane advancement. Like all new breakthroughs, you must be careful with who you allow to witness this ability. How will you use your fringe ability to create artificial intelligence?

When you adopt this specialization at 3rd level, you gain proficiency with calligrapher’s supplies. If you already have proficiency with calligrapher’s supplies you gain proficiency with another type of artisan’s tools of your choice.

Starting at 3rd level, you can awaken artificial minds. At the end of each long rest, you can touch a Tiny nonmagical object with calligrapher’s supplies, awakening a mind within. While the mind is inside it, the object is a magic item that requires attunement, and you can use it as a spellcasting focus. If you rouse an artificial mind while you already have one from this feature, the mind transfers to the new object. While attuned to the mind, you gain the following features:

Information Overload. Your artificial mind can overload the minds of your enemies with information. As an action, you can force a creature that you can see within 30 feet to make an Intelligence saving throw. On a failed save, it takes 1d8 psychic damage and disadvantage on the next attack roll it makes before the start of your next turn. The damage of this feature increases as you gain levels in this class: to 2d8 at 5th level, 3d8 at 11th, and 4d8 at 17th level.
Magical Telephony. You can communicate telepathically with any creature carrying one of your infused items within a 1-mile radius. The creature can respond telepathically.

Skill Proficiencies. You gain proficiency in two skills from the respective column on the table below. The material of the object that houses your artificial mind determines the skills you choose from, as its nature affects its innate knowledge.

sheet.description: At the end of each long rest, you can touch a Tiny nonmagical object with calligrapher’s supplies, awakening a mind within. While attuned to the mind, you can communicate telepathically with any creature carrying one of your infused items within a 1-mile radius. The creature can respond telepathically. Additionally, you gain two skill proficiencies based on the material of the object.

description.p: Your artificial mind can overload the minds of your enemies with information. As an action, you can force a creature that you can see within 30 feet to make an Intelligence saving throw. On a failed save, it takes 1d8 psychic damage and disadvantage on the next attack roll it makes before the start of your next turn. The damage of this feature increases as you gain levels in this class: to 2d8 at 5th level, 3d8 at 11th, and 4d8 at 17th level.

sheet.description: You can force a creature that you can see within 30 feet to make an Intelligence saving throw (DC {{spellcasting:dc:int}}) or take {{information-overload:damage-dice}}d8 psychic damage and disadvantage on the next attack roll it makes before the start of your next turn.

description.p: Starting at 5th level, when you deal psychic damage to a creature you gain a bonus to the damage roll equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of +1).

In addition, you can expend a spell slot to increase the psychic damage dealt by your Information Overload feature. The damage increases by 2d8 for a 1st-level spell slot, and an additional 1d8 for each spell level higher than 1st-level.

sheet.description: When you deal psychic damage to a creature you gain a +{{int-mod:min-one}} bonus to the damage roll. In addition, you can expend a spell slot to increase the psychic damage dealt by your Information Overload feature. The damage increases by 2d8 for a 1st-level spell slot, and an additional 1d8 for each spell level higher than 1st-level.

description.p: The cognitive abilities of the artificial mind have grown and it can aid you in spellcasting. Starting at 9th level, when you are forced to make a Constitution saving throw to maintain concentration on a spell, you gain a bonus to the saving throw equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of +1).

sheet.description: Starting at 9th level, when you are forced to make a Constitution saving throw to maintain concentration on a spell, you gain a +{{int-mod:min-one}} bonus to the saving throw.

description.p: Upon reaching 15th level you have attained the peak of archival expertise. As an action on your turn, you can turn into pure information and teleport to an unoccupied space within 60 feet that you can see, or to an unoccupied space within 5 feet of an object bearing one of your infusions.

sheet.description: You can turn into pure information and teleport to an unoccupied space within 60 feet that you can see, or to an unoccupied space within 5 feet of an object bearing one of your infusions.

description.p: Behind every great musician, every standing ovation, every sold out concert, there is someone who put quill to parchment and penned the notes. These great minds are known as composers. Unlike other bards and entertainers, composers take a more mathematical and cerebral approach to music and song. They are masters of patterns that go unnoticed, and when they apply their analytical minds to a problem it is only a matter of time before they find a solution.

When you adopt the composer specialty at 3rd level, you gain proficiency with smith’s tools and one instrument of your choice. If you already proficient with smith’s tools, you gain proficiency with another set of artisan’s tools of your choice.
At the end of a long rest, you can switch the instrument proficiency you gained from this feature with another instrument, provided you have the new instrument available.

sheet.description: At the end of a long rest, you can choose an instrument proficiency you gained from this feature with another instrument, provided you have the new instrument available.

description.p: Starting at 3rd level, you construct a completely unique musical instrument of your own design. You are proficient and with this instrument and it can be used as a spellcasting focus by you. Whenever you make skill check with this apparatus you can add double your proficiency bonus to the roll. If it is destroyed, you can construct a new musical apparatus with your smith’s tools at the end of a long rest.
You can only maintain one musical apparatus at a time, and if you create a new one, your previous musical apparatus falls into disrepair and becomes unusable.
Your musical apparatus can also be weaponized depending on its design. At the end of each long rest, you can choose one of the following options for your musical apparatus:

Raucous Blast. Your apparatus can assault creatures with a blast of painful sound. As an action, make a spell attack against a creature within 60 feet that can hear you. On hit the creature takes 1d8thunder damage and is deafened until the start of your next turn. The damage increases by 1d8 at 5th-level (2d8), and again at 11th-level (3d8), and 17th-level (4d8).

Ringing Strike. Your apparatus is a simple weapon with the versatile property, and it deals 1d8 (1d10) bludgeoning damage on hit. You are considered proficient with it, and you can use your Intelligence, in place of Strength, for attack and damage rolls. In addition, you can cast the booming blade spell as long as your apparatus is the material component.

sheet.description: You construct a completely unique musical instrument of your own design. You are proficient and with this instrument and it can be used as a spellcasting focus by you. Whenever you make skill check with this apparatus you can add double your proficiency bonus to the roll. At the end of each long rest, you can choose one of the following options for your musical apparatus: Raucous Blast or Ringing Strike.

You construct a completely unique musical instrument of your own design. You are proficient and with this instrument and it can be used as a spellcasting focus by you. Whenever you make skill check with this apparatus you can add double your proficiency bonus to the roll. At the end of a short or long rest, you can choose one of the following options for your musical apparatus: Raucous Blast or Ringing Strike.

description.p: Starting at 5th level, when you deal thunder damage to a creature you gain a bonus to the damage roll equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of 1).

In addition, when you attack with your musical apparatus, you can expend a spell slot to knock the target back. The creature is knocked back 10 feet for a 1st-level spell slot, and an additional 10 feet for each spell level higher than 1st.

sheet.description: When you deal thunder damage to a creature you gain a +{{int-mod:min-one}} bonus to the damage roll. In addition, when you attack with your musical apparatus, you can expend a spell slot to knock the target back. The creature is knocked back 10 feet for a 1st-level spell slot, and an additional 10 feet for each spell level higher than 1st.

description.p: Beginning at 9th level, as an action you can play a note at a pitch that causes a creature of your choice within 10 feet to resonate with undetectable vibrations for 1 hour. The next time that creature is hit with a melee attack, the attacker must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, they take 2d8 thunder damage and cannot take reactions until the beginning of their next turn. On a successful save they take half damage and can use their reaction as normal.
You may use this feature a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of 1), and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

sheet.description: You can play a note at a pitch that causes a creature of your choice within 10 feet to resonate with undetectable vibrations for 1 hour. The next time that creature is hit with a melee attack, the attacker must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, they take {{resonant-frequency:damage-dice}}d8 thunder damage and cannot take reactions until the beginning of their next turn. On a successful save they take half damage and can use their reaction as normal.

description.p: You have mastered both the theory and applications of sound and used this knowledge to improve the effectiveness of your musical apparatus and your composer techniques. Upon reaching 15th level, you gain the following features:

ul.li: You are immune to thunder damage and the deafened condition.
You can change the weaponized effect of your musical apparatus at the end of a short or long rest.
When you use your Thunderous Note feature Large or smaller are knocked prone.
The damage of Resonant Frequency becomes to 4d8.

sheet.description: You are immune to the deafened condition. When you use your Thunderous Note feature Large or smaller are knocked prone.

description.p: While most focus on singular inventions, dungeoneers use their know-how to weaponize mundane objects. Trusted to safeguard untold riches and powerful artifacts, dungeoneers use basic adventuring gear to construct defensive traps, puzzles, and structures that can repel all but the most hardy adventurers. Did you learn your craft in the service of a powerful creature, or under the tutilage of a master?

When you adopt the dungeoneer specialty at 3rd level, you gain proficiency with carpenter’s tools and mason’s tools. If you already proficient with either of these tools, you gain proficiency with another set of artisan’s tools of your choice.

Starting at 3rd level, when you finish a long rest, you can create a number of objects from the Dungeoncraft Table equal to your proficiency bonus. If an object forces a creature to make a saving throw they use your artificer spell save DC.

When you use your Dungeoncraft feature to create objects, select an object from the list below. Objects created with this feature appear as mundane versions of the objects, but turn to ash the following dawn after they are created.
Permanent objects can be created using the appropriate materials and tools as determined by your Dungeon Master.

sheet.description: When you finish a long rest, you can create up to {{proficiency}} objects from the Dungeoncraft Table. Objects created with this feature appear as mundane versions of the objects, but turn to ash the following dawn after they are created. Permanent objects can be created using the appropriate materials and tools as determined by your Dungeon Master.

description.p: Beginning at 3rd level, you can arm yourself with whatever is around you, turning mundane objects into weapons. You gain proficiency with improvised weapons, and when you attack with an improvised weapon you can use your Intelligence, in place of Strength or Dexterity, for attack and damage rolls.

sheet.description: You have proficiency with improvised weapons, and when you attack with an improvised weapon you can use your Intelligence, in place of Strength or Dexterity, for attack and damage rolls.

description.p: Starting at 5th level, you can attack twice, rather than once, whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.

sheet.description: You can attack twice, rather than once, whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.

description.p: Starting at 9th level, when you cast a Dungeoneer Spell that has a material component, you can cast the spell without providing the material component. Once you use this feature you must finish a long rest before you can do so again.
In addition, your improvised weapons and Dungeoncraft objects are considered magic for the purpose of overcoming resistances and immunities.

sheet.description: When you cast a Dungeoneer Spell that has a material component, you can cast the spell without providing the material component. Once you use this feature you must finish a long rest before you can do so again. In addition, your improvised weapons and Dungeoncraft objects are considered magic for the purpose of overcoming resistances and immunities.

description.p: You have become a master Dungeoneer. Upon reaching 15th level, when a creature makes a saving throw against one of your Dungeoncraft Objects or Dungeoneer Spells, they have disadvantage on their saving throw.
In addition you can cast the passwall and wall of stone spells as rituals. Their casting time becomes 1 hour, they don’t consume spell slots, and the structure is permanent.

sheet.description: When a creature makes a saving throw against one of your Dungeoncraft Objects or Dungeoneer Spells, they have disadvantage on their saving throw. In addition you can cast the passwall and wall of stone spells as rituals. Their casting time becomes 1 hour, they don’t consume spell slots, and the structure is permanent.

description.p: While most artificers are primarily inventors that take up a life of adventure to further their research or test experiments in the field, those known as forgewrights seek out battle for its own sake. Reveling in the thrill of combat, they combine their innovative spirit with their skill as a warrior to forge the signature weapon of a forgewright, an arcane armament.

When you adopt the forgewright specialty at 3rd level, you gain proficiency with smith’s tools and martial weapons. If you are already proficient with smith’s tools, you gain proficiency in another set of artisan’s tools of your choice.

Your intimate knowledge of warfare and arcane magic allows you to combine both with ease. Starting at 3rd level, you learn to forge an arcane armament. At the end of each long rest, you touch one melee weapon and turn it into your arcane armament, granting it the following properties:

ul.li: The weapon you is considered magic if it was not already.
You can use your Intelligence, in place of Strength or Dexterity, for the attack and damage rolls.
You gain a +1 bonus to your attack and damage rolls with it, unless the base weapon granted a higher bonus. This bonus increases to +2 at 9th-level and +3 at 15th-level.

It can bear one of your infusions, unless it was already a magic item before becoming your arcane armament. Bonuses granted by infusions to attack and damage rolls do not stack with the base bonuses of your arcane armament. You must choose one to use upon infusion.

description.p: Your arcane armament is usable only by you. Enchanting a second weapon causes the magic in the first to end.

sheet.description: At the end of each long rest, you touch one melee weapon and turn it into your arcane armament, granting it the following properties: The weapon you is considered magic if it was not already. You can use your Intelligence, in place of Strength or Dexterity, for the attack and damage rolls. You gain a +{{arcane-armament:bonus}} bonus to your attack and damage rolls with it, unless the base weapon granted a higher bonus. It can bear one of your infusions, unless it was already a magic item before becoming your arcane armament. Bonuses granted by infusions to attack and damage rolls do not stack with the base bonuses of your arcane armament. You must choose one to use upon infusion.

description.p: You wield your arcane armament as an extension of yourself. Starting at 5th level, you can attack twice, rather than once, whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.

sheet.description: You can attack twice, rather than once, whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.

description.p: Your connection with your arcane armament has grown, allowing you to enhance your strikes. Beginning at 9th level, when you hit a target with a magic weapon attack you can channel magical energy through your arcane armament to create one of the following effects:

ul.li: The target takes an extra 2d6 force damage. You can expend a spell slot to increase this damage. The damage increases by 1d6 per level of the spell slot you expend.
You gain temporary hit points equal to your artificer level.
You can force the target to make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save they are knocked prone.

description.p: You can use this ability a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of once), and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

sheet.description: When you hit a target with a magic weapon attack you can channel magical energy through your arcane armament to create one of the following effects: The target takes an extra 2d6 force damage. You can expend a spell slot to increase this damage. The damage increases by 1d6 per level of the spell slot you expend. You gain {{level:artificer}} temporary hit points. You can force the target to make a Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

description.p: You have become a master among forgewright artificers. Upon reaching 15th level, you can extend the power of your arcane armament to your allies. As an action, choose a number of weapons equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of 1) within 30 feet. For the next minute these weapons deal an additional 1d6 force damage on hit.
You can use this feature once per long rest, unless you spend a spell slot of 3rd-level or higher to use it again.

sheet.description: Choose up to {{int-mod:min-one}} weapons within 30 feet. For the next minute these weapons deal an additional 1d6 force damage on hit. You can use this feature once per long rest, unless you spend a spell slot of 3rd-level or higher to use it again.

description.p: Item: A rod or wand

This magic object is infused with a cantrip from the artificer spell list (your choice upon infusion). The user can use their action to produce the cantrip from the object, using your Intelligence as the spellcasting ability.

sheet.description: This magic object is infused with a cantrip from the artificer spell list (your choice upon infusion). The user can use their action to produce the cantrip from the object, using your Intelligence as the spellcasting ability.

description.p: Item: A glove or gauntlet

This tiny magical launcher can be loaded with a Tiny object, including but not limited to; ball bearings, caltrops, a vial of acid, holy water, or oil. As a bonus action the wearer can activate the launcher and make a ranged attack at a target within 20 feet. The launcher requires an action to reload with another Tiny object.

sheet.description: This tiny magical launcher can be loaded with a Tiny object, including but not limited to; ball bearings, caltrops, a vial of acid, holy water, or oil. As a bonus action the wearer can activate the launcher and make a ranged attack at a target within 20 feet. The launcher requires an action to reload with another Tiny object.

description.p: Item: A belt or cloak (requires attunement)
When worn, this magic belt reduces the user to one-tenth of their normal weight. Starting at 9th-level it reduces the wearer to one-hundredth of their normal weight.

sheet.description: When worn, this magic belt reduces the user to 1/{{featherweight-belt:ratio}} of their normal weight.

description.p: Item: A weapon with the heavy property
This magic weapon grants a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it, and it no longer has the heavy property.

sheet.description: This magic weapon grants a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it, and it no longer has the heavy property.

description.p: Item: A pair of goggles or glasses

While wearing these goggles, the wearer can see through lightly obscured areas without disadvantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks. In addition, the wearer no longer suffers the negative effects from the Sunlight Sensativity trait.

sheet.description: While wearing these goggles, the wearer can see through lightly obscured areas without disadvantage on Perception checks. In addition, the wearer no longer suffers the negative effects from the Sunlight Sensativity trait.

description.p: Item: A ranged or thrown weapon
The wielder of this magic weapon ignores the disadvantage imposed when attacking at the weapon’s long range.

sheet.description: The wielder of this magic weapon ignores the disadvantage imposed when attacking at the weapon’s long range.

description.p: Item: A whip or chain
This magic weapon grants a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it, and it’s damage die increases to 1d8.

sheet.description: This magic weapon grants a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it, and it’s damage die increases to 1d8.

description.p: Prerequisite: 6th-level artificer
Item: An armored gauntlet (requires attunement)

You attach either a martial weapon lacking the heavy or two handed properties, or a shield to the gauntlet. The wearer gains proficiency with the attached item, and it cannot be removed from the gauntlet while this infusion is active.

sheet.description: You attach either a martial weapon lacking the heavy or two handed properties, or a shield to the gauntlet. The wearer gains proficiency with the attached item, and it cannot be removed from the gauntlet while this infusion is active.

description.p: Prerequisite: 6th-level artificer
Item: A ring (requires attunement)
The wearer of this ring gains proficiency with one skill or tool, or they learn one language (your choice upon infusion).

sheet.description: The wearer of this ring gains proficiency with one skill or tool, or they learn one language (your choice upon infusion).

description.p: Prerequisite: 6th-level artificer
Item: a cloak, vest, or harness

This magic harness automatically sizes to fit the wearer, and can be worn over clothing or light armor. It has wing-like fins between your limbs that can slow your fall or allow you to glide. When you fall, and aren’t incapacitated, you subtract up to 100 feet from your fall when calculating falling damage, and can move 2 feet horizontally every 1 foot you fall.

sheet.description: This magic harness automatically sizes to fit the wearer, and can be worn over clothing or light armor. It has wing-like fins between your limbs that can slow your fall or allow you to glide. When you fall, and aren’t incapacitated, you subtract up to 100 feet from your fall when calculating falling damage, and can move 2 feet horizontally every 1 foot you fall.

description.p: Prerequisite: 6th-level artificer
Item: A pair of boots (requires attunement)

When the user is standing on a flat surface, they can use an action to activate the boots, magically fixing the user in place. Until you use an action to deactivate the boots, you do not move, even if you are defying gravity.
A creature can use an action to make a DC 30 Strength check, separating your boots from the surface on a success.

sheet.description: When the user is standing on a flat surface, they can activate the boots, magically fixing the user in place. Until you use an action to deactivate the boots, you do not move, even if you are defying gravity. A creature can use an action to make a DC 30 Strength check, separating your boots from the surface on a success.

description.p: Prerequisite: 6th-level artificer
Item: A sword hilt or wand (requires attunement)

While grasping the item, the wielder can use a bonus action to cause a blade of pure radiance to spring into existence, or dissapear, from the end of the item. While the blade exists, this magic item is a simple weapon with the finesse property. The luminous blade emits bright light in a 15-foot radius and dim light for an additional 15 feet. The light is sunlight.
The wielder gains a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this weapon, and deals 1d8 radiant damage on hit.

sheet.description: While grasping the item, the wielder can cause a blade of pure radiance to spring into existence, or dissapear, from the end of the item. While the blade exists, this magic item is a simple weapon with the finesse property. The luminous blade emits bright light in a 15-foot radius and dim light for an additional 15 feet. The light is sunlight. The wielder gains a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this weapon, and deals 1d8 radiant damage on hit.

description.p: Prerequisite: 6th-level artificer
Item: A pair of gloves or gauntlets (requires attunement)

These magical gauntlets have 4 charges. When the wearer hits a creature with an unarmed strike they can expend 1 charge and force the target to make a Strength saving throw against your artificer spell save DC. On a failed save, the creature is knocked back 15 feet. The gauntlets regain all expended charges at dawn.

sheet.description: These magical gauntlets have 4 charges. When the wearer hits a creature with an unarmed strike they can expend 1 charge and force the target to make a Strength saving throw against your artificer spell save DC. On a failed save, the creature is knocked back 15 feet. The gauntlets regain all expended charges at dawn.

description.p: Prerequisite: 10th-level artificer
Item: a suit of armor (requires attunement)

This armor has 4 charges. While wearing this magical armor the wearer can use an action to expend some of its charges to cast one of the following Spells: invisibility (2 charges) or greater invisibility (4 charges). The armor regains all expended charges at dawn.

sheet.description: This armor has 4 charges. While wearing this magical armor the wearer can use an action to expend some of its charges to cast one of the following Spells: invisibility (2 charges) or greater invisibility (4 charges). The armor regains all expended charges at dawn.

description.p: Prerequisite: 10th-level artificer
Item: A melee weapon (requires attunement)

You infuse a weapon with elemental energy. As a bonus action the wielder can speak the weapon’s command word (chosen upon infusion) and cause elemental energy to burst forth. The weapon deals an additional 1d4 of one of the following damage types, which you choose when you infuse the item: acid, cold, fire, or lightning damage.
The additional elemental damage from this infusion increases to 1d6 when you reach 14th level in this class.

sheet.description: You infuse a weapon with elemental energy. As a bonus action the wielder can speak the weapon’s command word (chosen upon infusion) and cause elemental energy to burst forth. The weapon deals an additional 1d4 of one of the following damage types, which you choose when you infuse the item: acid, cold, fire, or lightning damage. The additional elemental damage from this infusion increases to 1d6 when you reach 14th level in this class.

description.p: Prerequisite: 10th-level artificer
Item: A ring (requires attunement)

Upon infusing this magic ring you select one of the following damage types: acid, cold, fire, poison, lightning, or thunder. When the wearer casts a spell that deals the selected damage type, they can choose for the spell to deal maximum damage to one target of the spell, instead of rolling.
Once this ring is activated it cannot be used again until the wearer completes a short or long rest.

sheet.description: Upon infusing this magic ring you select one of the following damage types: acid, cold, fire, poison, lightning, or thunder. When the wearer casts a spell that deals the selected damage type, they can choose for the spell to deal maximum damage to one target of the spell, instead of rolling. Once this ring is activated it cannot be used again until the wearer completes a short or long rest.

description.p: Prerequisite: 10th-level artificer
Item: A melee weapon (requires attunement)

You enchant a weapon to drain life from enemies. When the wielder rolls a 20 on an attack roll with this weapon the target takes an additional 2d6 necrotic damage, provided it isn’t a construct or undead. The wielder gains temporary hit points equal to the extra necrotic damage dealt.
The additional necrotic damage from this infusion increases to 4d6 when you reach 14th level in this class.

sheet.description: You enchant a weapon to drain life from enemies. When the wielder rolls a 20 on an attack roll with this weapon the target takes an additional 2d6 necrotic damage, provided it isn’t a construct or undead. The wielder gains temporary hit points equal to the extra necrotic damage dealt.The additional necrotic damage from this infusion increases to 4d6 when you reach 14th level in this class.

description.p: Prerequisite: 14th-level artificer
Item: A helm, hat, or diadem (requires attunement)

The wearer of this magic helm is resistant to psychic damage, immune to the charmed and frightened conditions, and any magic that allows another creature to read their thoughts or telepathically communicate with them.

description.p: Prerequisite: 14th-level artificer

You have discovered the secrets to the creation of life. You learn the clone spell. It counts as an artificer spell for you, but it doesn’t count against your number of Spells Known. You can cast clone without expending a spell slot as long as you have the material components available.
If you replace this infusion with another at any point during the incubation period, the spell immediately fails.

description.p: Prerequisite: 14th-level artificer
Item: a melee weapon (requires attunement)

This item has 4 charges. While wielding this magic weapon, the user can use their action to cast steel wind strike, using the infused weapon as the spellcasting focus, without expending a spell slot. When cast in this way, the wielder uses your Intelligence as the spellcasting ability. The weapon regains all expended charges at the end of a long rest.
